problem.script: n1 = random.randrange(5,89,19) n2 = random.randrange(2,10,5) total = n1 / n2
problem.p: Use randomized variables n1 and n2 in any part of this exercise to create a randomized question for your students, where the randomized variables will differ when a student either submits their response, clicks to reset the problem, or when a different student looks at the same problem (depending on how you've set it up).
Make sure to have at least two randrange values, and also to visit the Settings section of your problem, and set the "Randomization" value to something other than "Never."
For this particular problem, the "Randomization" value is set to "On Reset."

solution.div: Using MathJax, you can see the correct corresponding randomized answer below: \[ $n1 / $n2 = $total \]
